title: Secession - A Dark Enchantment [1987 Synthpop]
description:
Secession was a Scottish synth pop band that existed between 1983 and 1987. Secession consisted of Peter J. Thomson, Carole L. Branston, Charlie D. Kelly, and J.L. Seenan. Their singer, Peter J. Thomson, who penned their most commercially successful song song "Touch (Part 3)", died in the late 1990s.

A Dark Enchantment was their only release on CD; this CD is prized by collectors of rare 1980s music. It's interesting to know that the single "Sneakyville" A popular dance club hit, was about the Charles Manson Family murders. Part of the lyrics goes like this:

 "Strangers all came to call in the dead of night, on a warm August evening back in 69" "But the screams so it seems noone heard at all, close your eyes when the family come to call" ...... spooky, chilling and awesome! 

Ripped at 320kbs, this is a re-post as requested.

Catalog#: CD SRN 11  
Format: CD, Album
 
Country: UK 
Released: 1987 
Genre: Electronic  
Style: Synth-pop  
Credits: Engineer - Wilf Smarties 
Mixed By - Steve Peck 
Producer - Secession , Wilf Smarties
